document_data.name: House of Hanif
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of Hanif''' was the largest desert tribe of [[Zakharan pantheon|enlightened]] [[Al-Badia]] within the [[Haunted Lands]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p43">
document_data.Base of Operations: The tribe lived within the vast expanse of the Haunted Lands, controlling a region surrounding both the [[Ghost Mountains]] and [[Al-Akara Mountains]]. They maintained a permanent base a day's ride west of [[Halwa]] in a ''[[Midani dictionary|qal'at]]'' once held by [[holy slayer]]s.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p43"/>
document_data.Activities: The House of Hanif sent an ambassador, [[Kerim bin Hanif]], to represent them at the court of [[Huzuz]]. They were intensely loyal to the [[Khalil al-Assad al-Zahir|Grand Caliph]], to the point where the other tribes of the Haunted Lands referred to them as the "Grand Caliph's hunting dogs." Lost pilgrims en route to Huzuz were often rescued by the tribe.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p43"/>
document_data.Members: Sheikh [[Kaldun bin Hanif]] ruled the tribe in 1367 DR. Their number swelled to around 10,000.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p43"/>
